CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, September 5, 1959, pg. 1, reads: "Plaster Fells Woman, 88 - Mrs. Anna Bey, 88, who lives alone at 709 Cherokee St., is recovering at home, after a nine-square-foot section of bathroom ceiling fell on her Sunday while she was taking a bath in her home, in an 80-year-old row of houses. Mrs. Bey's daughter, who lives next door, heard her aged mother's moans.  The child of one of Mrs. Bey's friends, Shirley Blackwell, give [the] victim a glass of water. - Harris Photo (More pictures on Page 3)"Cutline from two photographs in continued article on p. 3 reads: "Mrs. Anna Bey, 88 who lives alone in an 80-year-old triplex at 709 Cherokee St., was in bathtub shown above when the nine square-foot section of plaster from the ceiling, shown in right photo, above the opened bathroom door, fell and hit her on the head, knocking her out.  She was taken to Montefiore Hospital by a daughter, Mrs. Elizabeth Caddle, who lives next door at 709 Cherokee St. The daughter just happened to come over to see her mother a few minutes after she heard the loud thud and her her mother moaning in the tub.  Mrs. Bey was X-rayed at the hospital and allowed to return home, until the results of the X-rays are announced.  The building is owned by Frank W. Schornagle Real Estate Company, and Mrs. Caddle says that both she and her mother have repeatedly told the firm about repairing a leak above the tub. - Harris Photo."
TitMainTitle: Young girl, daughter of Shirley Blackwell, giving glass of water to bedridden Anna Bey after she sustained injuries from a partial ceiling collapse, 709 Cherokee Street
